issue.title: Bumped ruff to 0.12.4

repository.name: rotki
repository.description: A portfolio tracking, analytics, accounting and management application that protects your privacy

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Also wanted to bump mypy but it got quite a bit more complicated and I think I found an issue with mypy 1.17.0. The suggested fix of using cast or type ignores on all ABIs sounded completely wrong.

Issue here: https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/19483

body:
Hmm, I only see one new error, not four, in your example.

Smaller repro:
```
from typing import TypedDict, NotRequired, Sequence

class Component(TypedDict):
    type: str
    components: NotRequired[Sequence['Component']]

inputs: Sequence[Component] = [{
    'type': 'tuple',
    'components': [
        {'type': 'uint256'},
        {'type': 'address'},
    ]
}]
```

Bisects to #19147 , but that PR should mostly only be exposing behaviour latent in mypy

Hey you are right. My bad on number of errors. I pasted a different test I had made than the one in the output. I edited it now with one having 2 errors with mypy 1.17.

But I think the bug must be more specific than what I originally thought. Seems like dict literals are not recognized as valid TypedDict instances when used inside a Sequence for recursive/self-referential TypedDict types?

Taking your more minimal repro that seems to be the case? I am really not familiar with the internals of mypy, so can just point to what I see when using it. 

Can I provide another example to help you or is the error clear?

issue.title: Retain `None` as constraints bottom if no bottoms were provided
issue.body:
Current version replaces `None` (which indicates "no items") with an empty union (=`Uninhabited`). This breaks inference in some cases.

Fixes #19483.

body:
Okay, I probably know the root cause, but let's see the primer first to learn whether this fix is positive enough.

As an aside, please verify the text that some LLM has hallucinated for you before publishing it - use of tools, AI or not, is not a good reason to post unverified and misleading snippets.
Thank you guys for the quick reaction. I appreciate it.

issue.title: Adding optional support for Pydantic V2

repository.name: aibs-informatics-core
repository.description: Core library to be used as foundation across multiple projects

issue.body:
## What's in this Change?

https://alleninstitute.atlassian.net/browse/DT-8265

This change introduces pydantic (v2) backed data models. We implement that same `aibs_informatics_core.models.base.ModelBase` protocol that `SchemaModel` implements. 

Other notes:
- I've added pydantic as an optional dependency which allows us to smoothly transition to using it. I envision a major version update that removes the `SchemaModel` entirely and replaces it with the pydantic based model. 
- I have added a few annotated types (akin to marshmallows custom fields) and de-/serializers to help with converting things like iso formatted datetime strings and custom str class fields correctly  

### Commits:
- **initial changes to add pydantic v2 support**
- **fix get_version test**
- **make pydantic optional dependency, isolate pydantic imports**
- **add tests for new pydantic models**


## Testing

- added unit tests for the pydantic model



- verified that the install with no pydantic does not create issues


issue.title: Fix S3Path parent property to handle root-level keys and add corresponding tests

repository.name: aibs-informatics-core
repository.description: Core library to be used as foundation across multiple projects

issue.body:
## What's in this Change?

there is a bug in the `S3Path.parent` property when the path ends with a trailing slash. 

```
In [1]: from aibs_informatics_core.models.aws.s3 import S3URI

In [2]: x = S3URI("s3://mybucket/myfolder/mykey/")

In [3]: x.parent
Out[3]: 's3://mybucket/myfolder/mykey/'

In [4]: x.parent.parent
Out[4]: 's3://mybucket/myfolder/mykey/'
```

This fix ensurest the following behavior:
1. the true parent will be returned for any non empty string, regardless of trailing slash
2. for an empty key, the same root will be returned (parent of `s3://bucket/` -> `s3://bucket/`)  

## Testing

added unit tests

(note that a bug in mypy 17.0 is causing mypy failures https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/19483 - it should be fixed in a minor version update).

body:
nice!  I was about to report a duplicate and noticed this fixed it on a bisect -- here's my minimal reproduction:

```python
from typing import NamedTuple, Literal, Sequence

type Op = Literal["AND", "OR"]
type Tok = Op | NT

class NT(NamedTuple):
    x: Sequence[Tok]


def f() -> None:
    NT(["AND", "OR", NT([])])
```

perhaps a 1.17.1 ?
